results.title: Australia: the encounter
results.brief_description:
Recounts the story of Matthew Flinder’s circumnavigation around Australia, his trials across the Tasman, involvement with the Nagarrindjeri tribe and his encounters with a French explorer. The Aboriginal people clash with these “white ghosts”. On his way home to England, Flinders is imprisoned in Mauritius and his prized cat, Trim is killed. A decade later, Flinders returns home to his family. Meanwhile, the violence upon Aboriginal sacred lands continues.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Land is me
results.brief_description: In addition to writing and singing the theme song, 10 year old Shannon scripted, animated and helped edit this short film about the impact of early Australian settlement on Aboriginal cultures. Overall Winner of the Screen It! competition 2004. An animated short entered to “Create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Who Killed Target 1967?
results.brief_description: A vengeful female scientist, outraged by Godard’s victimisation of Anna Karina, constructs a beautiful female robot to seduce and destroy lovers attracted solely by physical beauty.

results.title: Drifting in Antarctica
results.brief_description: Alice, a profoundly deaf Zoologist, tells of her experience as a volunteer seabird observer on a working icebreaker in Antarctica. Featuring excerpts from “The rime of the ancient mariner” by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: Brewing up a fairytale
results.creator_credit: Christine Evely and Glenferrie Primary School
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program “Brewing up a new Tale: a live action production workshop” for lower primary. Students interact with Green Screen Technology and fairytale sets to learn the basics of narrative contruction, genre and and scene.

results.title: Shorter cuts: Snatch and grab (21/10/04)
results.creator_credit: Annemaree O'Brien and Bayside Secondary College
results.brief_description: From the ACMI Primary School Program “Snatch and Grab: Shorter Cuts Episode”. In the program, Middle Year Students script and shoot scenes for an episode of Shorter Cuts, based on the Burberry Productions TV series Short Cuts. The program was developed in collaboration with Burberry Productions, with assistance from Film Victoria and Seven Network.

results.title: Heart research
results.brief_description: David Crawford has always studied and worked in the field of science. With assistance from the Heart Foundation, it’s his work in public health research that provides the most satisfaction. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: 50 years of cardiology
results.brief_description: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.
